alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 17 at 5:48AM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 12 PM TO 9 PM SATURDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will continue across the area Saturday. Between 6 and 12 hours of single digit relative humidity readings are expected in the Middle Rio Grande Valley with a few hours possible elsewhere. Gusty westerly to southwesterly winds are expected in the afternoon and evening resulting in several hours of critical fire weather conditions. In addition to gusty winds and low humidity, a very unstable airmass will be in place. Any fires that develop will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and Central Highlands (125) Saturday afternoon and evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph, except 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph across along and just east of the Central Mountain Chain. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 5 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
